page.title: 01BACKGROUND
page.content: Our survey area covers most of Binfield including the village centre, and 5 of the 10 hamlets in Warfield. The area comes under the jurisdiction of Bracknell District Council. In 1981 Binfield had 3,091 inhabitants, while Warfield had just 1,609. The land is predominantly clay and gravel, used almost exclusively for agriculture. Warfield, originally a Saxon settlement,is recorded in The Domesday Book and probably derives its name from a clearing or field beside a pool. Scattered hamlets developed from single farms and the church lay isolated at the centre. The author of "The Origin of Finger Printing", Sir William Herschel lived at Rectory House. Warfield Hall was once the home of Sir Charles Brownlow. He did much for the village and also built a community hall-known as Brownlow Hall.
